passage_text: Shrubbery. A shrubbery is a wide border to a garden where shrubs are thickly planted; or a similar larger area with a path winding through it. A shrubbery was a feature of 19th-century gardens in the English manner, with its origins in the gardenesque style of the early part of the century. A shrubbery was a collection of hardy shrubs, quite distinct from a flower garden, which was a cutting garden to supply flowers in the house.

2. shrubbery-a collection of shrubs growing together. botany, flora, vegetation-all the plant life in a particular region or period; Pleistocene vegetation; the flora of southern California; the botany of China. bush, shrub-a low woody perennial plant usually having several major stems.

Wiktionary (0.00 / 0 votes) Rate this definition: shrubbery (Noun). A planting of shrubs; a wide border to a garden where shrubs are thickly planted; or a similar larger area with a path winding through it.

Nouns denoting spatial position. Hypernyms (shrubbery is a kind of...): area; country (a particular geographical region of indefinite boundary (usually serving some special purpose or distinguished by its people or culture or geography)).
Full Definition of SHRUBBERY. : a planting or growth of shrubs. See shrubbery defined for English-language learners. See shrubbery defined for kids. ADVERTISEMENT.

shrubberies. An object that is usually small and round-ish, and can consist of one or several various plants; usually fuzzy, short plants or thorns. They are known for their quaintness, delicacy, and outrageous prices. The Knights of Ni regarded this particular plant with great admiration.

Noun. 1. shrub-a low woody perennial plant usually having several major stems. bush. shrubbery-a collection of shrubs growing together. Catha edulis-a shrub that is cultivated by Arabs for its leaves which are chewed or used to make tea.
